qas.question: What has none of the research on memories revolved around?

context: One question <a0_0><b5_0>that is crucial<b5_0/><a0_0/> in cognitive neuroscience is how information and mental experiences are coded and represented in the brain. Scientists <a1_0><b4_0>have gained much knowledge<b4_0/><a1_0/> about the neuronal codes from the studies of plasticity, but most of such research has been focused on <a3_0><b7_0>simple learning in simple neuronal circuits<b7_0/>;<a3_0/> it is considerably less clear about the <b8_0>neuronal changes<b8_0/> involved in more complex examples of memory, particularly declarative memory that requires the storage of facts and events (Byrne 2007). Convergence-divergence zones <a2_0><b6_0>might be the neural networks where memories are stored and retrieved<b6_0/>.
